Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

Module for defining and running a FastAPI application.

This module contains the main code for setting up and running a FastAPI application with routes for authentication, contacts, and users.

The startup function is an event handler that initializes a connection to the Redis server for rate limiting.

The read_root function is a route handler for the root endpoint (“/”) of the FastAPI application.

The script runs the FastAPI application using uvicorn with host “0.0.0.0” and port 8000.

async main.read_root()¶

Route handler for the root endpoint (“/”) of the FastAPI application.

This function returns a JSON response with a message indicating that the task has started. It also applies rate limiting to restrict the number of requests to this endpoint.

async main.startup()¶

Event handler to initialize a connection to the Redis server.

This function is executed when the FastAPI application starts up. It initializes a connection to the Redis server for rate limiting using the settings from the configuration.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, user: User, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(start_date: date, end_date: date, user: User, db: Session)¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user, whose birthday will be in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • start_date (date) – The first day the search period.

  • end_date (date) – The last day of the search period.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user.

  • surname (str) – The surname of the contact to retrieve.

  • birthday (date) – The birthday of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

REST API routes Contacts¶

Module for contact routes. The router instance is created with a prefix of ‘/contacts’ and tagged as “contacts”.

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(contact: ContactCreate, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for creating contacts. This function handles POST requests to ‘/contacts/’ for creating new contacts. It restricts the number of requests to no more than 10 per minute.

Parameters:

  • contact (ContactCreate model.) – The contact data to create.

  • current_user (UserModel. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – The current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The created contact data.

Return type:

Contact model

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Route handler for deleting a specific contact.

This function handles DELETE requests to ‘/contacts/{contact_id}’ for deleting a contact. It restricts the number of requests to no more than 10 per minute.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • current_user (UserModel. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – The current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a success message.

Return type:

dictionary

Raises: HTTPException: If the contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Route handler for retrieving upcoming birthdays. This function handles GET requests to ‘/contacts/birthdays’ for retrieving contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days. It restricts the number of requests to no more than 10 per minute.

Parameters:

  • current_user (UserModel) – The current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Route handler for retrieving a specific contact.

This function handles GET requests to ‘/contacts/{contact_id}’ for retrieving a specific contact. It restricts the number of requests to no more than 10 per minute.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • current_user (UserModel. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)) – The current user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The retrieved contact data.

Return type:

ContactResponse form

Raises: HTTPException: If the contact is not found.

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(name: str = None, surname: str = None, email: str = None, phone: str = None, birthday: date = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Route handler for retrieving contacts. This function handles GET requests to ‘/contacts/’ for retrieving contacts based on specified criteria. It restricts the number of requests to no more than 10 per minute.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The contact’s name. Defaults to None.

  • surname (str) – The contact’s surname. Defaults to None.

  • email (str) – The contact’s email. Defaults to None.

  • phone (str) – The contact’s phone. Defaults to None.

  • birthday (date) – The contact’s birthday. Defaults to None.

  • current_user (UserModel) – The current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the specified criteria.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, contact_update: ContactUpdate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Route handler for updating a specific contact.

This function handles PUT requests to ‘/contacts/{contact_id}’ for updating an existing contact. It restricts the number of requests to no more than 10 per minute.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact_update (ContactUpdate model) – The updated contact data.

  • current_user (UserModel.) – The current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user)

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact data.

Return type:

ContactResponse form

Raises: HTTPException: If the contact is not found.

REST API routes Users¶

Module for user routes.

This module defines routes related to managing user profiles and avatars using the FastAPI APIRouter. It includes routes for retrieving user details, and updating user avatars. It imports necessary modules and dependencies including APIRouter, Depends, status, UploadFile, File, Session, cloudinary, cloudinary.uploader, get_db, User, repository_users, auth_service, settings, and UserDb. The router instance is created with a prefix of ‘/users’ and tagged as “users”. The read_users_me route handler handles GET requests to ‘/users/me/’ for retrieving details of the current user. The update_avatar_user route handler handles PATCH requests to ‘/users/avatar’ for updating the avatar of the current user.

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Route handler for retrieving user details.

This function handles GET requests to ‘/users/me/’ for retrieving details of the current user.

Parameters:

current_user (User model) – The current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Returns:

Details of the current user.

Return type:

User model

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for updating user avatar. This function handles PATCH requests to ‘/users/avatar’ for updating the avatar of the current user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile. Defaults to File().) – The avatar file to upload. Defaults to File().

  • current_user (User model) – The current user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Updated details of the current user with the new avatar.

Return type:

UserDb

REST API routes Auth¶

Module for authentication routes.

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for confirming user email addresses. This function handles GET requests to ‘/auth/confirmed_email/{token}’ for confirming user email using the verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The verification token.

  • db (Session) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

A dictionary containing a confirmation message.

Return type:

dictionary

Raises: HTTPException: If there is a verification error.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for user login. This function handles POST requests to ‘/auth/login’ for user login. It verifies the credentials, generates JWT tokens, and updates the refresh token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm, optional) – The login form data. Defaults to Depends().

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dictionary

Raises: HTTPException: If the email is invalid, not confirmed, or the password is incorrect.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for token refresh. This function handles GET requests to ‘/auth/refresh_token’ for token refresh. It verifies the refresh token, generates new access and refresh tokens, and updates the refresh token in the database.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials, optional) – The HTTP authorization credentials. Defaults to Security(security).

  • db (Session) – The database session. Defaults to Depends(get_db).

Returns:

A dictionary containing the access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

dictionary

Raises: HTTPException: If the refresh token is invalid.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for requesting confirmation emails.

This function handles POST requests to ‘/auth/request_email’ for requesting confirmation emails. It sends a confirmation email if the user email is not already confirmed. :param body: The request email data model. :type body: RequestEmail data model :param background_tasks: Background tasks for sending email. :type background_tasks: BackgroundTasks data model :param request: Background tasks for sending email. :type request: BackgroundTasks data model :param db: The database session. :type db: Session :return: A dictionary containing a confirmation message. :rtype: dictionary

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Route handler for user signup. This function handles POST requests to ‘/auth/signup’ for user registration. It checks if the user already exists, hashes the password, creates a new user, and sends a confirmation email using background tasks.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user data model containing username, email, and password.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks model) – Background tasks for sending email.

  • request (Request model) – The incoming request object.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the newly created user and a confirmation message.

Return type:

dictionary

Raises: HTTPException: If the account already exists.

REST API service Auth¶

Module for authentication services.

This module defines an Auth class that provides various methods for user authentication and token management. An instance of the Auth class named auth_service is created for authentication purposes.

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

Class containing authentication methods. Attributes: - pwd_context (CryptContext): Password hashing context. - SECRET_KEY (str): Secret key for token generation. - ALGORITHM (str): JWT encryption algorithm. - oauth2_scheme (OAuth2PasswordBearer): OAuth2 password bearer scheme. - r (Redis): Redis instance for caching user data.

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶

  • data (dict) – Data to encode in the token.

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Expiry time for the token. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Encoded access token.

Return type:

str

  • expires_delta (float, optional) – Expiry time for the token. Defaults to None.

Returns:

Encoded refresh token.

Return type:

str

Decode refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token (str) – Refresh token to decode.

Returns:

Email associated with the refresh token.

Return type:

str

Raises: HTTPException: If the token is invalid.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Current user details.

Return type:

User model

Raises: HTTPException: If the token is invalid or user is not found.

pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify password hash.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Plain password.

  • hashed_password (str) – Hashed password.

Returns:

True if the plain password matches the hashed password, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

Module for sending email notifications.

This module defines an send_email function for sending email notifications using the FastAPI Mail library. The function uses a ConnectionConfig object to configure the email server settings based on the application settings. It then attempts to send an email with the provided details including the email address, username, and host.

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send email notification.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the recipient.

  • username (str) – Username of the recipient.

  • host (str) – Host URL for email verification link.

Raises: ConnectionErrors: If there is an error connecting to the email server.
